posts.title: Smart Home Alone!
posts.description:
Smart outlets and home automation are becoming more popular every year, but these devices are often lacking some advanced features and have undesirable connections to the Internet. In this class we'll show you how to take control of your own smart outlets using software like ESPHome and Home Assistant. Bring your own Raspberry Pi or use one of our demo setups.

Old laptops work really well for Home Assistant too! Make sure it has an Ethernet port.

Event fee of $5 for non-members and free for Hacksburg members.

posts.title: Metal Casting
posts.description:
Make your own sand cast Aluminum object at our casting class! Sand casting is an exciting process that's very accessible to the hobbyist. Ages 16 and up; wear all cotton clothes and long pants.

If you have something wood or 3D printed that you'd like to cast, bring it along! If it's a complicated shape, you may want to talk to us first. Feel free to email board@hacksburg.org with questions.

posts.title: Fifth Annual Holiday Ornaments
posts.description:
Join Hacksburg for a festive and family-friendly DIY workshop session where makers of all ages can make their own personalized gifts including laser cut felt Christmas ornaments, custom laser cut wooden displays and cards, and hand polished metal wind chimes.

The event is free, but donations to cover material costs are greatly appreciated!

posts.title: Resin Printer Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's 8K SLA resin printer
posts.description:
Normal filament-based 3D printers are capable of making an incredible array of parts, but for high-detail miniatures our new resin printer is capable of over 10x the resolution. Learn how to use the Hacksburg resin printer, what parts work best, and how these machines differ from filament-based printers. The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members.

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Sewing 101
posts.subtitle: With a sewing machine!
posts.description: Learn the basics of sewing using the sewing machines at Hacksburg. Attendees will make a basic project (likely a pillow case). This class is for ages 14 and up. The class is free for Hacksburg members and $5 for non-members.

posts.title: Hacksburg Halloween
posts.subtitle: 👻 Get your spook on 🎃
posts.description:
Show off your coolest costume at the weekly meeting, bonus points for DIY! Bring a (small) pumpkin and get it laser engraved on Hacksburg's laser cutter.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

No RSVP required!

posts.title: Fermentation and Hard Cider Basics
posts.subtitle: Intro to Homebrewing
posts.description:
We will cover the basics of turning apple cider (and other fruit juices) into an alcoholic drink. Works great with fresh cider from the Ninth Annual Hacksburg Cider Making!

This class is for attendees age 21 and up. No underage class attendees permitted.

posts.title: Intro to Solar Power
posts.subtitle: Clean energy from the sun
posts.description:
A group discussion of solar power from grid-scale, to rooftop, to portable and how you can get started.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Ninth Annual Hacksburg Cider Making
posts.subtitle: Fresh, all-natural, and delicious!
posts.description:
Come to Hacksburg with apples and you'll be able to make your own cider! The best kind of apples to bring is a variety, only using one type typically results in extremely sweet or tart cider. Ten pounds of apples makes three quarts of cider. No RSVP required.

Want more information? We go into the Cidermaking process in detail here: https://hb.gy/0nAyF...

Cider making is for attendees of all ages. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay the whole time your child/dependent is there.

posts.title: Ninth Annual Hacksburg Cider Making
posts.subtitle: Fresh, all-natural, and delicious!
posts.description:
Come to Hacksburg with apples and you'll be able to make your own cider! The best kind of apples to bring is a variety, only using one type typically results in extremely sweet or tart cider. Ten pounds of apples makes three quarts of cider. No RSVP required.

Want more information? We go into the Cidermaking process in detail here: https://hb.gy/0nAyF...

Cider making is for attendees of all ages. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay the whole time your child/dependent is there.

posts.title: Apple Grinder Prep
posts.subtitle: Apples go brrr
posts.description:
Help replace the motor on Hacksburg's apple grinder in preparation for cider making.

No RSVP required!

posts.title: Working with LEDs
posts.subtitle: Give your costume a glow-up
posts.description:
Learn about the types of LED lights and how to integrate them into costumes and cosplay.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: 3D Printer Community Work Day
posts.subtitle: Make your printer harder, better, faster, stronger!
posts.description:
Got a 3D printer and have questions? Something doesn't work? Want to make your printer harder, better, faster or stronger? This event offers a shared work day for community members to work on and improve our 3D printers. All knowledge levels welcome. Bring your printer!

Instructions on how to customize and compile firmware for your 3D printer will also be presented.

This class is for attendees age 16 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Costume and Cosplay Tips and Tricks
posts.subtitle: Prep for spook season 🎃
posts.description:
Ask questions and get advice on your costumes from Hacksburg's award winning instructor. This is a casual, unstructured discussion, so please bring your costumes and questions!

Event takes place online only.

Open for ages 12+. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Photogrammetry
posts.subtitle: 3D scans from your camera
posts.description:
A group discussion of the tools and techniques for photogrammetry, a method of extracting 3D information from photographs.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Animation in Blender
posts.subtitle: Pixels, Shapes, and Motion
posts.description:
Learn the basics of the award-winning open source 3D design and animation software Blender. Attendees will learn how to compose scenes, animate objects, create materials and textures, and render a final scene. This class will focus on learning the software, as opposed to the artistic aspect of 3D animation.

Ages 14+. Minors will need to have parent/guardian supervision for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Maple Tree Identification Walk
posts.description: Prepare for Maple syrup season by learning how to identify the many varieties of maple trees. Although maple tapping takes place in the winter, maple trees are most easily identified in the fall due to their distinct, vibrant leaves!

posts.title: Laser Cutter 101
posts.subtitle: Make Your Own Edge-Lit Acrylic Sign
posts.description:
This workshop covers the Hacksburg 80W CO2 laser cutter. Basic laser safety, design guidelines, and examples will be presented. Attendees will learn how to make their own edge-lit acrylic sign and receive the LED base with the optional materials fee.

Free for members and $5 for non-members, plus $10 optional materials fee.

This event has been rescheduled

posts.title: DIY Home Maintenance
posts.subtitle: Was that hole always there?
posts.description:
Learn how to perform basic home repairs and maintenance. Will cover preventative items as well as repairs including: minor drywall patching, unclogging a drain, fixing a leaking faucet or toilet and more.

If there is a specific repair or maintenance item you would like to see, please let us know!

$5 for members and $10 for non-members.

posts.title: Laser Taco Tuesday
posts.subtitle: Its a fiery fiesta
posts.description:
Customize your Taco Tuesday experience by laser engraving your tortilla on Hacksburg's 80W CO2 laser cutter! Tortillas and fillings will be provided, bring your own tortilla design ideas.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

This event is free, but donations to cover ingredients are appreciated!

posts.title: Hacksburg Open House
posts.subtitle: Part of Game Changer Week
posts.description:
Hacksburg is a non-profit Makerspace located in Blacksburg, VA. Started in 2014, we're a community workshop focused on enabling creatives and entrepreneurs in the New River Valley to complete projects that would otherwise be out of reach. Whether you need equipment, mentorship, or just some space to work, Hacksburg is meant to be an accessible, collaborative, and affordable resource for building anything from rockets to robots to rocking chairs.

Hacksburg members must be 18+, but all ages are welcome at this open house. If you are bringing attendees under 18, you (parent/guardian) must stay for the duration of the class.

posts.title: Intro to CNC Machining
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's CNC gantry router
posts.description:
In part one of our series of CNC classes, attendees will learn how to do basic CNC operations and think like a machinist. Details will be given for the operation of Hacksburg's CNC gantry router, generously donated by Onefinity and Torc Robotics, and we will machine a demonstration part.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Canning Basics
posts.subtitle: You can-can do it!
posts.description:
Canning is a method of preserving food that can extend the shelf life of a variety of foods, even vegetables from your own garden. This class covers canning for beginners. Discussion time will be included for your own specific canning questions and to learn what others are canning.

This class is for attendees age 12 and up. If you are bringing an attendee under 18, you (the parent/guardian) must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Forest Maintenance Discussion
posts.description:
Participate in a group discussion about forest maintenance.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Animation in Blender
posts.subtitle: Pixels and Shapes
posts.description:
Learn the basics of the award-winning open source 3D design and animation software Blender. Attendees will learn how to compose scenes, animate objects, create materials and textures, and render a final scene. This class will focus on learning the software, as opposed to the artistic aspect of 3D animation.

Ages 14+. Minors will need to have parent/guardian supervision for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: E-Commerce Mini-class
posts.description:
Explore your options for collecting money on a website. Attendees will discuss their experiences and best practices for e-commerce.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Basic Web Development
posts.subtitle: That's what spiders do, right?
posts.description:
Want to set up your own website? Learn the basics of HTML, CSS, and Javascript in order to create a custom website. Hosting will be discussed, including the special options available to Hacksburg members.

Ages 16+. Minors will need to have parent/guardian supervision for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Intro to Slide Rules Mini-class
posts.description:
Learn how to use a slide rule to perform calculations, no electronics required! Slide rules will be provided for a hands-on demonstration, feel free to bring your own.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Using AI Tools Mini-class
posts.description:
Learn how to access and use AI tools including chatbots and image generators. Will also discuss limitations and risks of these tools. Bring a computer!

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Intro to Programming with Python
posts.subtitle: Learn the basics of the Python programming language
posts.description:
Attendees will learn the basics of the Python programming language. Python is an exciting programming language which enables you to program anything from smart light bulbs to the world's largest supercomputers.

Laptop required. Ages 14+, If you are bringing an attendee under 18, the parent/guardian must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Future Aerial Transport Mini-class
posts.description:
A time to discuss concepts in future aerial transportation including personal aircraft, alternative fuels, and more!

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: Bicycle Repair Day
posts.subtitle: Two wheels good!
posts.description:
Have a bike that needs work? Hacksburg will host a work session to provide help with basic bicycle repair and maintenance. Hacksburg will supply space, tools, cleaners and lubricants; attendees will provide bicycles and spare parts.

Ages 14+, If you are bringing an attendee under 18, the parent/guardian must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all shop tool use.

posts.title: Working with Stepper Motors Mini-class
posts.description:
Learn how stepper motors work, why you would want to use them, and how to add them to your projects.

Join online at meet.hacksburg.org/OpenGroupMeeting

Mini-classes are shorter 30-90 minute casual events held after the weekly meeting. They may introduce a new topic, expand on a previous class, or be a forum for discussion. No RSVP required!

posts.title: 3D Printer Community Work Day
posts.subtitle: Make your printer harder, better, faster, stronger!
posts.description:
Got a 3D printer and have questions? Something doesn't work? Want to make your printer harder, better, faster or stronger? This event offers a shared work day for community members to work on and improve our 3D printers. All knowledge levels welcome. Bring your printer!

Ages 16+, If you are bringing an attendee under 18, the parent/guardian must stay for the entire duration of the class.

posts.title: Leatherworking Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn how to make long-lasting leather goods
posts.description:
Today, most leather hides are discarded and completely wasted, but you can still make many useful things, like shoes, belts, bags, and clothing from leather. This class will cover selecting leather, project planning, cutting, sewing, molding, decoration, and finishing. Attendees can make a cell phone holster or/and a decorative drink coaster, as time permits.

Ages 16+, If you are bringing an attendee under 18, the parent/guardian must stay for the entire duration of the class and approve all shop tool use.

posts.title: Hacksburg Open House
posts.subtitle: Tour our Community Workshop
posts.description:
Hacksburg is a non-profit Makerspace located in Blacksburg, VA. Started in 2014, we're a community workshop focused on helping creatives and entrepreneurs in the New River Valley complete projects that would otherwise be out of reach. Whether you need equipment, mentorship, or just a place to work, Hacksburg is an accessible, collaborative, and affordable resource where you can build anything from rockets to robots to rocking chairs.

Hacksburg members must be 18+, but all ages are welcome at this open house. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of their visit.

posts.title: Hacksburg at Summer Solstice Fest
posts.subtitle: The summer festival for locals
posts.description: Hacksburg will be exhibiting at the Downtown Blacksburg Summer Solstice Fest. Come out and enjoy hands-on activities, locally made products for sale, food trucks, live music, and more! This event is free and family friendly.Learn more at downtownblacksburg.com.

posts.title: Modern Kites
posts.subtitle: These aren't just for the beach!
posts.description:
Learn how modern kites are designed and constructed using advanced materials. Stunt kites, kiteboarding, and even kite photography will be discussed.

This event is open to all ages, but attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class.

posts.title: Modifying CAD
posts.subtitle: Learn to modify existing models for 3D printing
posts.description:
There are an incredible variety of 3D models available online for 3D printers. But what if you need to change something about a model to suit your needs? In this class, you'll learn basic and advanced techniques for modifying 3D models.

This class is intended for ages 16 and up, but younger attendees with 3D printing experience are welcome if you confirm with the board ahead of time (board@hacksburg.org). Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class.

posts.title: Building Radios
posts.subtitle: A hands-on lesson in electromagnetism
posts.description: In this class, attendees will build radios in groups while learning the basics of how sound is transmitted using electromagnetic waves. Digital data transmission (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, etc) will be surveyed with enough information to ignite future learning. Ages 14+.

posts.title: Resin Printing Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's 8K SLA resin printer
posts.description:
Filament-based 3D printers are capable of making an incredible array of parts, but, for high-detail miniatures, our new resin printer is capable of over 10x the resolution. In this class, you'll learn how to use Hacksburg's resin printer, which kind of parts are best-suited to resin printing, and how these machines differ from filament-based printers.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Synthesizer Mini-Class
posts.subtitle: Bebop to the boolean boogie
posts.description: Learn how to make a basic electronic synthesizer by connecting digital and analog electronic components in ways their designers never intended! Attendees will learn the basics of synthesizers and how they are implemented in this informal class after the regular Tuesday meeting.

posts.title: Intro to CNC Machining
posts.subtitle: Learn to use Hacksburg's CNC gantry router
posts.description:
In part one of our series of CNC classes, attendees will learn how to do basic CNC operations and think like a machinist. Details will be given for the operation of Hacksburg's CNC gantry router, generously donated by Onefinity and Torc Robotics, and we will machine a demonstration part.

This class is for ages 16 and up. Attendees under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the full duration of the class, and parent/guardian must approve all equipment use.

posts.title: Seedstarting and Gardening Basics
posts.subtitle: Learn how to grow your own food
posts.description: Get ready for garden season by learning how to start your own plants from seed. Starting from seed saves money and increases the variety of plants you can grow! This class will also cover basic garden prep information such as mixing soil and making planters. The class fee covers a seed-starting kit and seeds. Feel free to bring your own seeds as well!
